results.title: The Surveillance Apparatus That Surrounded Britney Spears
results.abstract: An account by a former employee of the security team hired by Ms. Spears’s father created the most detailed portrait yet of the singer’s life under 13 years of conservatorship.
results.byline: By Liz Day and Samantha Stark

multimedia.caption: Britney Spears in Las Vegas in 2018. A new documentary by The New York Times, “Controlling Britney Spears,” which examines the security operation surrounding the singer, was released on Friday.

results.title: He Taught Ancient Texts at Oxford. Now He Is Accused of Stealing Some.
results.abstract: Hobby Lobby, the craft chain that helped build a collection for the Museum of the Bible, has sued a former Oxford lecturer, asserting he sold it stolen artifacts.

multimedia.caption: Dirk Obbink, in 2005, at the Sackler Library of the University of Oxford, which houses the Egypt Exploration Society’s Oxyrhynchus collection. He has denied having taken anything from the collection.

results.title: George Mraz, Consummate Jazz Bassist, Dies at 77
results.abstract: For half a century, he was in constant demand, backing big names like Oscar Peterson as well as countless up-and-coming performers.

multimedia.caption: George Mraz in performance in about 1977. He established himself as one of the most in-demand bassists in jazz early in has career and retained that status for decades.
multimedia.copyright: Tom Copi/Michael Ochs Archives, via Getty Images

results.title: Anita Hill Has Some Perspective to Offer
results.abstract: Thirty years after she testified before the Senate, the law professor talks about the experience, sexual harassment and her growing impatience with the slow pace of change.
des_facet: Believing: Our Thirty-Year Journey to End Gender Violence (Book)

multimedia.caption: Writing her new book, “Believing,” felt urgent, Anita Hill said, because “I don’t know how much longer I’m going to be doing this. I don’t even know how much longer I’m going to be around. I want to get all of this out.”
multimedia.copyright: Amani Willett for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Writing her new book, “Believing,” felt urgent, Anita Hill said, because “I don’t know how much longer I’m going to be doing this. I don’t even know how much longer I’m going to be around. I want to get all of this out.”

results.title: Wole Soyinka Is Not Going Anywhere
results.abstract: The Nobel laureate, whose new novel, “Chronicles From the Land of the Happiest People on Earth,” is his first in nearly 50 years, refuses to back down when he senses that his homeland’s freedom is under threat.
des_facet: Chronicles From the Land of the Happiest People on Earth (Book)

multimedia.caption: “Unfortunately, some of us are not very wise. We know what we ought to do, when we should retire, go and hide out somewhere, live a life of ease,” Wole Soyinka said. “But we don’t take our own advice, do we?”
multimedia.copyright: Yagazie Emezi for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: “Unfortunately, some of us are not very wise. We know what we ought to do, when we should retire, go and hide out somewhere, live a life of ease,” Wole Soyinka said. “But we don’t take our own advice, do we?”

results.title: Charles G. Sellers, Historian Who Upset the Postwar Consensus, Dies at 98
results.abstract: A Southerner who became a radical at Berkeley, he argued that democracy developed in America as a response to the emergence of industrial capitalism.

multimedia.caption: The historian Charles G. Sellers in 2007. His commitment to progressive causes was evident in his writing as well as his politics.

results.title: Man Convicted in Thefts of a van Gogh and a Hals From Dutch Museums
results.abstract: DNA evidence found at the two museums after the burglaries led investigators to the suspect, who has now been sentenced to eight years in prison by a Dutch court.
org_facet: Museum Hofje van Mevrouw van Aerden (Leerdam, Netherlands)

results.title: Disney Sues to Keep Complete Rights to Marvel Characters
results.abstract: The company filed several lawsuits seeking to invalidate copyright-termination notices served by artists and illustrators involved with creating superheroes like Spider-Man and Thor.
